CARDINAL . Rules on access to medical assistance for convicted prisoners are set out in LAW DATE ( ORG karny wykonawczy – “ the DATE Code ” ) , which entered into force on DATE .
CARDINAL . NORP The relevant part of LAW provides as follows :
“ A convicted person shall have access to free health care ... ”

Article CARDINAL was substantially amended in DATE and on subsequent occasions , the amendments extensively covering the range of medical assistance available to convicted persons and rules for its application . The provision referred to above remained unchanged in substance .
CARDINAL . As regards access to medical assistance for persons detained on remand , LAW provides as follows :

“ Unless exceptions are provided for in the present LAW , a person detained on remand shall enjoy at least the same rights as are secured to a convicted person serving a sentence of imprisonment under the ordinary regime in a closed prison . No restrictions shall be applied to him except such as are necessary to secure the proper conduct of criminal proceedings , to maintain order and security in a remand centre and to prevent demoralisation of remand prisoners . ”
